author: Staff Reporter
text:
Suspecting foul play in the death of a 19-year-old boy, parents and relatives blocked the road outside the Namakkal District Headquarters Hospital here on Friday.

E. Chandru of Bodinaickenpatti, a student of a private polytechnic college, used to work in brick kiln unit in the same area during holidays. His work was to load bricks in vehicles.

On Thursday night, he left for the work. But on Friday morning, unit owner Kumar informed Chandru’s parents that he fell from the tractor and died on the spot. The body was taken to the hospital.

On Friday, when the post-mortem examination began, the parents said that there were no injuries on the body and suspected foul play in their son’s death.

They wanted the post-mortem examination to be stopped and staged a protest outside the post-mortem room. The post-mortem was stopped. The relatives later blocked Mohanur Road disrupting traffic.

Namakkal DSP Manoharan and Inspector Sivaraman held talks with the protestors. They said that based on the post-mortem report, a case would be registered by the Erumapatty police. Later, the protest was withdrawn and the post-mortem examination continued. The relatives received the body and left the hospital.
title: Relatives allege foul play in youth’s death
